item.title: Police shuts down Manson cybercrime market, arrests key suspects
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: German law enforcement has seized over 50 servers that hosted the Manson Market cybercrime marketplace and fake online shops used in phishing operations. [...]

item.title: New Android spyware found on phone seized by Russian FSB
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: After a Russian programmer was detained by Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) for fifteen days and his phone confiscated, it was discovered that a new spyware was secretly installed on his device upon its return. [...]

item.title: Latrodectus malware and how to defend against it with Wazuh
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Wazuh
item.description: Latrodectus is a versatile malware family that infiltrate systems, steal sensitive data, and evades detection. Learn more from Wazuh about Latrodectus malware and how to defend against it using the open-source XDR. [...]

item.title: Mitel MiCollab zero-day flaw gets proof-of-concept exploit
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Researchers have uncovered an arbitrary file read zero-day in the Mitel MiCollab collaboration platform, allowing attackers to access files on a server's filesystem. [...]

item.title: Microsoft says having a TPM is "non-negotiable" for Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft made it abundantly clear this week that Windows 10 users won't be able to upgrade to Windows 11 unless their systems come with TPM 2.0 support, stating it's a "non-negotiable" requirement. [...]

item.title: White House: Salt Typhoon hacked telcos in dozens of countries
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Chinese state hackers, known as Salt Typhoon, have breached telecommunications companies in dozens of countries, President Biden's deputy national security adviser Anne Neuberger said today. [...]

item.title: FBI shares tips on how to tackle AI-powered fraud schemes
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The FBI warns that scammers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to improve the quality and effectiveness of their online fraud schemes, ranging from romance and investment scams to job hiring schemes. [...]

item.title: UK disrupts Russian money laundering networks used by ransomware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​A law enforcement operation led by the United Kingdom's National Crime Agency (NCA) has disrupted two Russian money laundering networks working with criminals worldwide, including ransomware gangs. [...]

item.title: BT unit took servers offline after Black Basta ransomware breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Multinational telecommunications giant BT Group (formerly British Telecom) has confirmed that its BT Conferencing business division shut down some of its servers following a Black Basta ransomware breach. [...]

item.title: New DroidBot Android malware targets 77 banking, crypto apps
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android banking malware named 'DroidBot' attempts to steal credentials for over 77 cryptocurrency exchanges and banking apps in the UK, Italy, France, Spain, and Portugal. [...]

item.title: Solana Web3.js library backdoored to steal secret, private keys
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The legitimate Solana JavaScript SDK was temporarily compromised yesterday in a supply chain attack, with the library backdoored with malicious code to steal cryptocurrency private keys and drain wallets. [...]

item.title: Russian hackers hijack Pakistani hackers' servers for their own attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The notorious Russian cyber-espionage group Turla is hacking other hackers, hijacking the Pakistani threat actor Storm-0156's infrastructure to launch their own covert attacks on already compromised networks. [...]

item.title: Japan warns of IO-Data zero-day router flaws exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Japan's CERT is warning that hackers are exploiting zero-day vulnerabilities in I-O Data router devices to modify device settings, execute commands, or even turn off the firewall. [...]
